Coe: look at commissions differently. Don't share internally until it is fully baked. Wants each project to be seductive, irresistible #PTiO
Hooper-White: pacakge is important to selling a show internally #PTiO
Hooper-White: need to become the pitch-person internally, need to demonstrate it can sell, ratings etc #PTiO
Regina: at SyFy they don't start with scripts, start with episodic concepts/outlines to sell the show internally #PTiO
Regina: pace of show depends on network or service that you are developing for #PTiO
@klashton27 broadcasters and distributors, too
Coe: not just about bringing on an experienced showrunner, need showrunner who is passionate about concept and will live it/breathe it #PTiO
Christine Shipton: showrunners need to buy-in to the partnerships and respect all of the copro partners #PTiO
Regina: if you don't love your content, how will you make me love it? #PTiO
Regina: don't generalize your pitch. Should be tailored to the network #PTiO
Hooper-White is shocked how many producers pitch that don't understand their network #PTiO
Halpern: Must watch television. Need to understand why a network programs a show. Know your buyer, competition, their competition #PTiO
Regina: broadcasters talk to each other and discuss experiences with different producers #trackrecord important #no2ndchances #PTiO
Regina: it is very hard internally at networks to get a project greenlit. Experience producer helps get show approved #PTiO
Coe encourages inexperienced producers to find their own partners, will mean a better fit #PTiO
Coe: As budgets climb, experience becomes more important. Partner with experienced producer or the risk is too great #PTiO
Hooper-White: experience of the producer is important. As a buyer you want to know what your going to get. Partner with EP if needed #PTiO
Halpern: need to do your research about different broadcasters - schedules, what audience, which writers, what fits #PTiO
Halpern: you don't want all convo to go through producer, different broadcasters also need to talk to each other #PTiO
Coe: partners need to be respectful and honest for things to work #PTiO
Halpern: shorter orders make a better start for copros - partnership and show can evolve/develop with more time #PTiO
Halpern: #thefirm CDN and US broadcaster wanted different things - not a recipe for success #PTiO
Hooper-White: diff deals inform which partners influence more, including release dates etc. collaboration between broadcasters too #PTiO
Hooper-White: we wanted to sync up with Canada for #marykillspeople but didn't time out. Want show to succeed in each territory #PTiO
Regina: projects can't come together without collaboration. Scheduling can get tricky. Compromise needed. #PTiO
Hooper-White: creative comes first, copro/biz model comes after #PTiO
Halpern: wanted to ensure they had a clear vision before pitch so potential partners really understood and they could find right fit #PTiO
Halpern: Polley write the scripts for #AliasGrace then looked at budget and realized they needed more $ #PTiO
Halpern: you could not make Flashpoint for the same budget today #PTiO
Dhaliwhal: not everything works as a coproduction #PTiO
Halpern: harder and harder to produce shows for lower budgets that compete. Netflix looking at what does at $20M/hr show look like? #PTiO
Halpern: this is about money. No one goes into a copro because it is fun. #PTiO
Regina: If I waited for pitches, it would take too long. #PTiO
Regina: SyFy has no development budget at all. Often brainstorm internally then go out to find right producing partners #PTiO
Coe: the more developed the more that you can see if it will work for the network, or not #PTiO
Coe: tend to spend longer on development in Canada (2-5yrs) #PTiO
@klashton27 Data driven. Huge in the Phillipines. One of the top 5 TV series there is from Wattpad. #PTiO
Hooper-White: we want to see more of a package. More than a script. Who are the other players/partners? Need alignment #PTiO
Hooper-White: want the best content from wherever it comes from #PTiO
Coe: there are new players now, new opportunities #PTiO
Regina: coproduction makes content more affordable #PTiO
Halpern: Regina: there is a tremendous appetite for content, creates more opportunities #PTiO
Halpern: copros are not new, but there is an increased desire to coproduce now #PTiO
New Approaches to US Mkt panel w/ Dhaliwhal @DentonsCanada Coe @BellMediaPR Halpern @HalfireEnt Hooper-White @lifetimetv Regina @Syfy #PTiO
Albert: need to seperate the wheat from the chaff - there is great talent out there #PTiO
Graham: will see some services die away, not all can survive #PTiO
Sharma: New players will continue to enter content market, FAANG, platforms, telcos etc. #PTiO
Hustvedt: Will see Facebook and Amazon as buyers and taking more audience #PTiO
Schneider: we will see more and amazing premium content in new spaces/more global rights issues/biz models erosion #PTiO
Piracy is out of control with teenagers (60 yr-old women as well) - no one wants to pay #piracy #ripped #PTiO
Schneider: starting to see renewals on scripted. This is new. Becoming more important to retain rights #PTiO
Hustvedt: Consumers want the Spotify for entertainment to exist - too hard due to rights at the moment (Netflix is close) #PTiO
Sharma: short form is monetizable but not looking at revenue per video - looks at network as a whole #PTiO
Hustvedt: The more you spend, the higher the demand for ROI #margins #PTiO
Schenider: budgets are growing as value of content rises #PTiO
Schneider: talent always sells #PTiO
Hustvedt: in digital must think about a marketing driven approach #audiencefocus #PTiO
Hustvedt: Digital a lot about telling stories that you can't see on traditional #underservedstories #PTiO
Schneider: Differnece between digital and TV, in digital you can go out and make it yourself #PTiO
Schneider: because more traditional execs are coming into digi companies, more development and pitch docs needed, proof of concept vid #PTiO
Sharma: Forget the buyer. Who is their audience? What do they care about? #PTiO
Graham: to find audience need better/more assets and access to talent #PTiO
Graham: From creator side - I miss the guerilla promotion and hunger for getting their content seen. #PTiO
Schneider: digital talent knows the space and audience and how to reach them. Experienced producers can help to raise the quality #PTiO
Schneider: our biz is built on marrying digital first talent with traditonal storytelling to elevate content #PTiO
Hustvedt: no one hit more than $10M on a influencer film yet. Opportunity for a hit #PTiO
More info on Camp Takota: https://t.co/zhq4uMR7Ah #PTiO
Albert: are new creators challenged by budget/schedule etc. Does this create a new opp for traditional producers to step in? Help? #PTiO
Sharma: 72 hrs uploaded to YouTube every minute, really hard to build audience, there are now infinite channels around the world #PTiO
Sharma: As more internet delivered platforms emerge, formats will expand (# of eps, length etc.) #PTiO
Sharma: formats are currently being driven by need to monetize/licence. No reason that a program should be a certain length #PTiO
Sharma: If digital concepts yielding great data (and broad audience) then maybe could be TV. Starts by testing w/ 'kids' in the office #PTiO
Sounds like 'niche' is also a distinguising factor for digital projects #PTiO
Schneider: not cannabalising TV, just another way to tell a story #PTiO
Schneider: We ask ourselves - is this just television? How do we change the storytelling to create a unique voice for digital/mobile? #PTiO
Albert: Is this just TV? TV Lite? Undercutting traditional? The formats are increasingly looking like traditional media #PTiO
Hastvedt: be careful with output deals because you end up locked to a one customer and beholden to their model/audience #PTiO
Hustvedt: was feature film focussed (esp. Direct to consumer distribution). Now adding series. Must be agnostic #PTiO
Schneider: Still the #wildwest. Making it up as we go. Most revenue is coming through licensing #PTiO
Schneider: doing tons of pilots - have now sold over 20 pilots to different platforms. #PTiO
Schneider "we just have to start making things" #PTiO
Schneider: assumption was that great content will find an audience and then find the money/windowing #PTiO
Schneider: NewForm is new (3 yrs in) focus is original scripted for digital platforms - started short form, has evolved #PTiO
Graham: market has forced us to get in earlier (launched 4 origs in last year) - here in Canada looking #buying #opportunity #PTiO
Graham: No longer worried about rack space (DVDs) now see themselves as a network - working with prods and distribs #SVOD #PTiO
Graham: Acorn has been bring UK content (and #MurdochMysteries) to NA audiences for over 30 yrs. Started with DVDs #PTiO
